Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: locust
Description: Locust is an easy to use, scriptable and scalable Python-based performance testing tool

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Show program's version number and exit

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Show this help message and exit

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Show program's version number and exit

Arguments.Name: files...
Arguments.Description: files...

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Config file path

Arguments.Name: files...
Arguments.Description: files...

Arguments.Name: -H
Arguments.Description: Host to load test in the following format: http://10.21.32.33

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: Peak number of concurrent Locust users. Primarily used together with --headless or --autostart

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Rate to spawn users at (users per second). Primarily used together with --headless or --autostart

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Stop after the specified amount of time, e.g. (300s, 20m, 3h, 1h30m, etc.)

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Show list of possible User classes and exit

Arguments.Name: --web-host
Arguments.Description: Host to bind the web interface to. Defaults to '*' (all interfaces)

Arguments.Name: -P
Arguments.Description: Port on which to run web host

Arguments.Name: --headless
Arguments.Description: Disable the web interface, and start the test immediately

Arguments.Name: --autostart
Arguments.Description: Starts the test immediately (without disabling the web UI)

Arguments.Name: --autoquit
Arguments.Description: Quits Locust entirely, X seconds after the run is finished

Arguments.Name: --web-auth
Arguments.Description: Turn on Basic Auth for the web interface. e.g. username:password

Arguments.Name: --tls-cert
Arguments.Description: Optional path to TLS certificate to use to serve over HTTPS

Arguments.Name: tls-cert
Arguments.Description: tls-cert

Arguments.Name: --tls-key
Arguments.Description: Optional path to TLS private key to use to serve over HTTPS

Arguments.Name: tls-key
Arguments.Description: tls-key

Arguments.Name: --class-picker
Arguments.Description: Enable select boxes in the web interface to choose from all available User classes and Shape classes

Arguments.Name: --master
Arguments.Description: Set locust to run in distributed mode with this process as master

Arguments.Name: --master-bind-host
Arguments.Description: Interfaces (hostname, ip) that locust master should bind to

Arguments.Name: --master-bind-port
Arguments.Description: Port that locust master should bind to

Arguments.Name: --expect-workers
Arguments.Description: How many workers master should expect to connect before starting the test (only when --headless/autostart is used)

Arguments.Name: --expect-workers-max-wait
Arguments.Description: How long should the master wait for workers to connect before giving up. Defaults to wait forever

Arguments.Name: --worker
Arguments.Description: Set locust to run in distributed mode with this process as worker

Arguments.Name: --master-host
Arguments.Description: Host or IP address of locust master for distributed load testing. Only used when running with --worker. Defaults to 127.0.0.1

Arguments.Name: --master-port
Arguments.Description: Show list of possible User classes and exit

Arguments.Name: --csv
Arguments.Description: Store current request stats to files in CSV format

Arguments.Name: --csv-full-history
Arguments.Description: Store each stats entry in CSV format to _stats_history.csv file. You must also specify the '--csv' argument to enable this

Arguments.Name: --print-stats
Arguments.Description: Print stats in the console

Arguments.Name: --only-summary
Arguments.Description: Only print the summary stats

Arguments.Name: --reset-stats
Arguments.Description: Reset statistics once spawning has been completed. Should be set on both master and workers when running in distributed mode

Arguments.Name: --html
Arguments.Description: Store HTML report to file path specified

Arguments.Name: --skip-log-setup
Arguments.Description: Disable Locust's logging setup. Instead, the configuration is provided by the Locust test or Python defaults. --loglevel LOGLEVEL, -L LOGLEVEL

Arguments.Name: --loglevel
Arguments.Description: Choose between DEBUG/INFO/WARNING/ERROR/CRITICAL. Default is INFO

Arguments.Name: loglevel
Arguments.Description: loglevel

Arguments.Name: INFO
Arguments.Description: loglevel

Arguments.Name: WARNING
Arguments.Description: loglevel

Arguments.Name: DEBUG
Arguments.Description: loglevel

Arguments.Name: ERROR
Arguments.Description: loglevel

Arguments.Name: CRITICAL
Arguments.Description: loglevel

Arguments.Name: --logfile
Arguments.Description: Path to log file. If not set, log will go to stderr

Arguments.Name: logfile
Arguments.Description: logfile

Arguments.Name: --show-task-ratio
Arguments.Description: Print table of the User classes' task execution ratio. Use this with non-zero --user option if some classes define non-zero fixed_count attribute

Arguments.Name: --show-task-ratio-json
Arguments.Description: Print json data of the User classes' task execution ratio. Use this with non-zero --user option if some classes define non-zero fixed_count attribute

Arguments.Name: --exit-code-on-error
Arguments.Description: Sets the process exit code to use when a test result contain any failure or error

Arguments.Name: --equal-weights
Arguments.Description: Use equally distributed task weights, overriding the weights specified in the locustfile

Arguments.Name: --enable-rebalancing
Arguments.Description: Allow to automatically rebalance users if new workers are added or removed during a test run

Arguments.Name: -T
Arguments.Description: List of tags to include in the test, so only tasks with any matching tags will be executed

Arguments.Name: --E
Arguments.Description: List of tags to exclude from the test, so only tasks with no matching tags will be executed
